body_html:
+1 to what @yaroslavvb said above. The tf.train.MonitoredSession class contains utilities that help with recovery after a failure.

In the current implementation, after a tf.Session.run() call fails due to a worker failure, the tf.Session object is no longer usable. The tf.train.MonitoredSession takes care of re-creating a new session and running code to restore from a checkpoint, if necessary.

body:
+1 to what @yaroslavvb said above. The [`tf.train.MonitoredSession`](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/train/distributed_execution#MonitoredSession) class contains utilities that help with recovery after a failure.

In the current implementation, after a `tf.Session.run()` call fails due to a worker failure, the `tf.Session` object is no longer usable. The `tf.train.MonitoredSession` takes care of re-creating a new session and running code to restore from a checkpoint, if necessary.
